intro: Polydiclis quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved polydiclis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive four-valved fruits. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, textured surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
